body.raw:
{
        "title": "Madol Duwa: A Timeless Tale of Adventure and Friendship",
        "content": "If you're looking for a book that captures the essence of youthful adventure, resilience, and the beauty of nature, Madol Duwa by Martin Wickramasinghe should be at the top of your reading list. This beloved Sri Lankan novel, first published in 1947, is more than just a story; it's a journey that takes you into the heart of rural Sri Lanka, where two boys embark on a life-changing adventure.\n\nThe story follows Upali, a mischievous young boy, and his friend Jinna as they escape the constraints of traditional life and society's expectations. Together, they explore the uninhabited island of Madol Duwa, turning it into their own paradise. What makes this book truly special is the way it captures the spirit of freedom and the thrill of self-discovery. As Upali and Jinna learn to fend for themselves, they grow stronger, both physically and mentally, teaching readers valuable lessons about independence and friendship.\n\nMadol Duwa is not just for young readers; its universal themes of adventure, courage, and the yearning for freedom resonate with all ages. Wickramasinghe's vivid descriptions of the lush Sri Lankan landscape make the setting come alive, immersing readers in the sights, sounds, and smells of the island.\n\nI highly recommend Madol Duwa to anyone looking for an engaging, heartwarming read. Whether you're a fan of adventure stories or simply enjoy books that celebrate the beauty of nature and the power of friendship, Madol Duwa is a classic that should not be missed.",
        "name": "sakura",
        "createdAt": "2024-08-29T04:05:53.359Z",
        "date": "2024-08-29T04:05:54.354Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-08-29T04:05:53.359Z",
        "__v": 0
    }

{
        "title": "රෝස පාට හීන ",
        "author": "Anjali Budawatta Jayawardena",
        "genre": "Self Help & Personal Development",
        "ratings": [],
        "ratingsCount": 0,
        "averageRating": 0,
        "description": "මනෝ අධ්‍යාපනික කරුණු (Psycho-education) අන්තර්ගත මෙම කෘතිය තුළ පුද්ගල ජීවන අත්දැකීම් තුළින් හා සිද්ධි අධ්‍යයනය තුළින් නව මානයකින් ජීවිතය දෙස බැලීමට අත්වැල් සපයයි. ඕනෑම පුද්ගලයෙකු දැන සිටිය යුතු මනෝ අධ්‍යාපනික කරුණු වෙත පාඨක අවධානය යොමු කරවන අතර පුද්ගලයා තුළ මානසික වශයෙන් ඔරොත්තු දීමේ ශක්තිය දියුණු කරලීමට දායක වන කරුණු ඇතුළත් ග්‍රන්ථයකි.",
        "imageUrl": "https://mdgunasena.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/10189417-2.jpg",
        "year": 2023,
        "reviews": [],
        "createdAt": "2024-08-29T13:34:10.341Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-08-29T13:34:10.341Z",
        "__v": 0
    },

{
   
        "title": "Madol Duwa: A Timeless Tale of Adventure and Friendship",
        "content": "If you're looking for a book that captures the essence of youthful adventure, resilience, and the beauty of nature, Madol Duwa by Martin Wickramasinghe should be at the top of your reading list. This beloved Sri Lankan novel, first published in 1947, is more than just a story; it's a journey that takes you into the heart of rural Sri Lanka, where two boys embark on a life-changing adventure.\n\nThe story follows Upali, a mischievous young boy, and his friend Jinna as they escape the constraints of traditional life and society's expectations. Together, they explore the uninhabited island of Madol Duwa, turning it into their own paradise. What makes this book truly special is the way it captures the spirit of freedom and the thrill of self-discovery. As Upali and Jinna learn to fend for themselves, they grow stronger, both physically and mentally, teaching readers valuable lessons about independence and friendship.\n\nMadol Duwa is not just for young readers; its universal themes of adventure, courage, and the yearning for freedom resonate with all ages. Wickramasinghe's vivid descriptions of the lush Sri Lankan landscape make the setting come alive, immersing readers in the sights, sounds, and smells of the island.\n\nI highly recommend Madol Duwa to anyone looking for an engaging, heartwarming read. Whether you're a fan of adventure stories or simply enjoy books that celebrate the beauty of nature and the power of friendship, Madol Duwa is a classic that should not be missed.",
        "name": "sakura",
        "createdAt": "2024-08-29T04:05:53.359Z",
        "date": "2024-08-29T04:05:54.354Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-08-29T04:05:53.359Z",
        "__v": 0
    }

{
   
        "title": "Madol Duwa: A Timeless Tale of Adventure and Friendship",
        "content": "If you're looking for a book that captures the essence of youthful adventure, resilience, and the beauty of nature, Madol Duwa by Martin Wickramasinghe should be at the top of your reading list. This beloved Sri Lankan novel, first published in 1947, is more than just a story; it's a journey that takes you into the heart of rural Sri Lanka, where two boys embark on a life-changing adventure.\n\nThe story follows Upali, a mischievous young boy, and his friend Jinna as they escape the constraints of traditional life and society's expectations. Together, they explore the uninhabited island of Madol Duwa, turning it into their own paradise. What makes this book truly special is the way it captures the spirit of freedom and the thrill of self-discovery. As Upali and Jinna learn to fend for themselves, they grow stronger, both physically and mentally, teaching readers valuable lessons about independence and friendship.\n\nMadol Duwa is not just for young readers; its universal themes of adventure, courage, and the yearning for freedom resonate with all ages. Wickramasinghe's vivid descriptions of the lush Sri Lankan landscape make the setting come alive, immersing readers in the sights, sounds, and smells of the island.\n\nI highly recommend Madol Duwa to anyone looking for an engaging, heartwarming read. Whether you're a fan of adventure stories or simply enjoy books that celebrate the beauty of nature and the power of friendship, Madol Duwa is a classic that should not be missed.",

{
   
        "title": "Madol Duwa: A Timeless Tale of Adventure and Friendship",
        "content": "If you're looking for a book that captures the essence of youthful adventure, resilience, and the beauty of nature, Madol Duwa by Martin Wickramasinghe should be at the top of your reading list. This beloved Sri Lankan novel, first published in 1947, is more than just a story; it's a journey that takes you into the heart of rural Sri Lanka, where two boys embark on a life-changing adventure.\n\nThe story follows Upali, a mischievous young boy, and his friend Jinna as they escape the constraints of traditional life and society's expectations. Together, they explore the uninhabited island of Madol Duwa, turning it into their own paradise. What makes this book truly special is the way it captures the spirit of freedom and the thrill of self-discovery. As Upali and Jinna learn to fend for themselves, they grow stronger, both physically and mentally, teaching readers valuable lessons about independence and friendship.\n\nMadol Duwa is not just for young readers; its universal themes of adventure, courage, and the yearning for freedom resonate with all ages. Wickramasinghe's vivid descriptions of the lush Sri Lankan landscape make the setting come alive, immersing readers in the sights, sounds, and smells of the island.\n\nI highly recommend Madol Duwa to anyone looking for an engaging, heartwarming read. Whether you're a fan of adventure stories or simply enjoy books that celebrate the beauty of nature and the power of friendship, Madol Duwa is a classic that should not be missed.",
        "name": "sakura",
